{| class="wikitable" !'''''[[Gluster_File_System_Documentation | Home!!]]''''' |} This is a place-holder for description of features in GlusterFS. All new features to be developed will need an entry here. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/BD '''Block Device Translator'''] Block Device translator [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/client_t '''client_t'''] Refactor server_connection_t in xlator/protocol/server to a new client_t in libglusterfs. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/Disperse '''Disperse'''] A new layout translator that uses an information dispersal algorithm (IDA) to fragment the file contents and disperse them amongst a set of bricks with a configurable level of redundancy [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/DRC '''Duplicate Request Cache'''] DRC for GlusterNFS to provide resilience to rpc restransmissions of non-idempotent operations. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/ElasticBrick '''Elastic Brick'''] Currently in concept. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/event-history '''Event History'''] Maintain an in-memory history of events happening [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/Hooks '''Event Hooks'''] Volume lifecycle extensions. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/Inotify '''Inotify'''] Inotify is a File system event monitoring tool which is is essential for many types of programs ranging from file managers to security tools. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/multi-tenancy '''Multi Tenancy'''] Concept stage [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/NFSACL '''NFSACL'''] ACLv3 support for NFS. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/Opversion '''Operating Version'''] “operating-version” support in ''glusterd'' is required to ensure that different versions of gluster binary bits interact with each other without problems. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/PuppetModule '''Puppet Module'''] [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/PuppetModuleWIP '''Puppet Module (WIP)'''] Build a puppet module for installing/adding node to a Gluster cluster. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/Server-quorum '''Server Quorum'''] This feature, when enabled, kills the bricks in the volume that do not meet the quorum because of network splits/outages. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/snapshot '''Snapshot'''] Crash consistent snapshot of glusterfs volumes [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/SplitNetwork '''Split Network'''] For many users, having a separate network exclusively for servers is highly desirable for both performance reasons (segregating administrative traffic and/or second-hop NFS traffic from ongoing user I/O) and security reasons (limiting administrative access to the private network). [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/features/worm '''Write Once Read Many times option'''] “worm” support in ''gluster volume set <volname> worm on'' is required to enable volumes to be converted a worm type. === Feature Template === To introduce new features, see the link below. Be sure to include links to code or a site where you describe the project. [http://www.gluster.org/documentation/architecture/Feature_Template Feature Template]
